snippet: In 2014, Mayor Bill de Blasio’s allies gave generously to Democratic groups outside New York City amid his bid to remake the State Legislature. That money has dried up this year amid fund-raising inquiries....
abstract: Many donors who gave money to candidates supported by New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio in 2014 in elections for New York State Senate are now shying away from further contributions; reticence stems in part  from state and federal investigations into whether or not 2014 donations were used to circumvent campaign finance limits and were part of pay-to-play scheme.

byline.original: By WILLIAM NEUMAN and J. DAVID GOODMAN

lead_paragraph: In 2014, Mayor Bill de Blasio’s allies gave generously to Democratic groups outside New York City amid his bid to remake the State Legislature. That money has dried up this year amid fund-raising inquiries.

headline.main: Mayor de Blasio’s Donors Are Avoiding Democrats in State Senate Races
headline.print_headline: De Blasio’s Donors Avoid Democrats in State Senate Races
